Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a portrait-bust of an empress. The angular shoulder is decorated with a band of ring-and-dot patterns between a groove and the discus. At the rear is an unpierced notched handle. The lamp stands on a raised base.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2060)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
